name: Overview

[{"id":"e069e646-2826-43ba-88e7-f1f587918fa4","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Analysis Execution and Control Flow","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"eb49bc6e-cc5c-431f-bd28-0c3bf5a58d89","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods within the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraphGenerator","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" manages the active execution of the analysis engine. It coordinates the "phases" of the scan, ensuring that the transition from a static file list to a dynamic call graph happens in a controlled, logical sequence. These methods act as the conductor for the underlying "Machinery," deciding when to step into new modules and how to consolidate findings across different code paths.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2690dfbb-4b24-4d69-8af2-54664c9910be","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"0c8d3cea-757a-455b-a908-b08e6604614e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a7d8e29e-9502-489b-ba19-eafc9ee7dbf8","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"do_pass(cls, install_hooks, modules_analyzed, *args, **kwargs)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The primary execution logic for a single scan cycle.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"09bec1cb-6a92-4b62-ad18-3f9a9f680322","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It iterates through all designated ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"entry_points","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0158c32a-5fac-479f-84a8-a93d7c3da396","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dynamic Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"install_hooks","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is enabled, it activates the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to intercept and record dependencies as they are encountered.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cf3219d9-026f-4608-8ac4-6249e06a6094","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Processing","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It instantiates the provided processor class (typically ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ExtProcessor","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") for each entry file, which then performs the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) traversal.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bfcc319e-7e0f-47dd-8c7e-9e77eeef915a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Module Aggregation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It maintains a union of all ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"modules_analyzed","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ensuring the engine doesn't waste resources re-scanning the same file twice.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b739f945-cd38-4cfd-b072-b6e903876b26","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Local Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": After file-level analysis, it triggers ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_localfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to resolve internal functions discovered within the local project modules.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"d20c9b6f-2452-4e28-9997-4caf07044420","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"extract_state()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Captures a high-fidelity snapshot of the engine’s internal memory. It exports the current state of the symbol table (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), the lexical hierarchy (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and the inheritance chains (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"classes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This is essential for features like incremental analysis or for developers to inspect exactly how Jarvis resolved a specific variable's value-flow.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a4d6caa7-96ce-42d8-b488-8827e920eb87","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"analyze()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The high-level trigger for the analysis process. It initializes performance monitoring, resets global counters (like the assignment count ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cnt","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"gol","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and initiates the primary ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This is the single method typically called by the CLI or an external API to start a project scan.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ef0ebff2-677b-41c1-8eb0-b4af24ad41d6","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"d78c2f59-abef-4701-be29-b5e5fcc58601","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f2b3912-2875-44ab-89dc-efc8917c45d0","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method serves as the standard starting point, while ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows for more granular control if performing multi-stage analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"845c0144-ad44-4ac8-9809-fd981b60cd81","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# 1. Start the standard analysis lifecycle
cg_generator.analyze()

# 2. Inspect the internal state after the analysis to see resolved values
current_state = cg_generator.extract_state()

# You can now see every definition and what it points to:
# print(current_state["defs"]["app.auth.login"])","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"df69b378-004b-42f2-ac70-651655ee302f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"64fa8b75-60ba-4331-9b26-4df4dc5ff38a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recursive Depth","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By coordinating ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", Jarvis can follow a chain of imports from a main script into nested utility modules, building a complete project-wide model.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3ee6c596-b5d6-4669-9bea-f7d7ac3405bc","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Pass Atomicity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The structure of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"do_pass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows Jarvis to perform multiple "passes" over the code—for example, a first pass to discover definitions and a second pass to resolve complex pointer logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"de71e2f1-3860-447d-ae19-445015d2a15c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hook Lifecycle Management","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The method carefully installs and removes import hooks around the processor's activity, ensuring the Python runtime environment is only modified when absolutely necessary for dependency tracking.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"842161cf-6e9f-4694-ae9c-68418ae5c59b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
